H0.text: Which creature is mythically said to sing before it dies, hence an expression for a grand final performance before retirement. Nightingale

H1.text: Which creature is mythically said to sing before it dies, hence an expression for a grand final performance before retirement. Phoenix

H2.text: Which creature is mythically said to sing before it dies, hence an expression for a grand final performance before retirement. Peacock

H3.text: Which creature is mythically said to sing before it dies, hence an expression for a grand final performance before retirement. Swan

A4.text: The phrase refers to an ancient belief that swans sing a beautiful song just before their death while they have been silent (or alternatively not so musical) for most of their lifetime.

A5.text: Aristotle noted in his History of Animals that swans 'are musical, and sing chiefly at the approach of death'.
